main event: A witness reported seeing a blue-green, circular object that appeared to be around 100 feet in diameter and burnt out over Vandalia, Ohio on May 9, 1959.
interesting points: The object moved quickly, stopping abruptly and making sharp right-angle turns.
The object appeared to be a bright, circular or blurred shape.
The witness estimated the object's size as being similar to a headlight or lighted lantern.
The witness reported the object disappearing from view, but did not provide details on how it vanished.
The witness was driving west at around 20 mph when the sighting occurred, and stopped to observe the object.
